meanings.definition: Shifted toward shorter wavelengths, as in the spectrum of light.
meanings.sent1: The blueshifted stars appear closer to us.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the blueshifted light from the distant galaxy.
meanings.sent3: The blueshifted sky made the astronomers excited about their discovery.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like a blueshifted beam of light, getting brighter and closer.
meanings.sent5: The blueshifted colors of the rainbow were stunning against the dark sky.

meanings.definition: To undergo a shift toward shorter wavelengths.
meanings.sent1: The galaxy blueshifted as it moved away from us.
meanings.sent2: The light from the star blueshifted as it approached the observer.
meanings.sent3: The car blueshifted through traffic, trying to reach the destination on time.
meanings.sent4: His mood blueshifted from happy to sad after hearing the news.
meanings.sent5: The music blueshifted in tone, creating a sense of urgency and excitement.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon of shifting toward shorter wavelengths.
meanings.sent1: The blueshifted of the light indicated the object was moving towards us.
meanings.sent2: The blueshifted of the stars was a fascinating discovery for the astronomers.
meanings.sent3: The sudden blueshifted of the traffic surprised the drivers on the road.
meanings.sent4: The blueshifted of emotions in the room created a tense atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The blueshifted of the sound made the concert unforgettable for the audience.
